Pre-Game Insights: The Oklahoma City Thunder will be completing a back-to-back of when hosting Memphis on Sunday but that should not have a big effect on how they play.
Oklahoma City has covered the number in eight of its last 10 and will likely face a Memphis team that will be without star point guard Ja Morant, who injured his shoulder on Friday.
Final Score Prediction, Oklahoma City Thunder wins and covers ATS 116-105.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis is 22-10 and first in the Southwest Division, a half-game ahead of the Houston Rockets.
The Grizzlies may have lost Ja Morant as the guard left Friday's game with a shoulder injury and is doubtful for Sunday.
Jaren Jackson Jr is leading Memphis in scoring, averaging 21.5 points per game.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is scoring an average of 31.1 points per game and handing out an average of 6.1 assists per game to lead Oklahoma City in both.
Oklahoma City has four players averaging double figures in scoring.
The Thunder score an average of 115.2 points per game.
Memphis scores an average of 123.7 points per game.
Others: Oklahoma City is 24-5 and leads the Northwest division by 8 games over the Denver Nuggets.
The Thunder defeated the Indiana Pacers 120-114 on Thursday night with Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tying his career high of 45 points.
Jalen Williams averages 5.9 rebounds per game to lead the Thunder.
Desmond Bane averaging 15.3 points per game and is the active leader in assists, averaging 4.7 per game.
Zach Edey is the leading rebounder, averaging 7.9 per game.
